Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay lets tackle this problem So the task is to analyze the event log find activities that repeat in the same case with different contexts rename them to reflect those differences and then justify the changes

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: First I need to look through each case and see which activities are repeated Lets go case by case

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with C001 The activities are Initiate Request Verify Documents Call Customer Submit Additional Verify Documents again Approve Request So Verify Documents happens twice here Looking at the context first time its Agent checks identity documents Then after the customer submits additional docs the second Verify is rechecks documents now that ID scan is provided So the first Verify is initial check the second is a recheck after missing docs were provided

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: In C002 activities are Initiate Verify Documents Call Customer Adjust Account Call Customer again Approve So Call Customer is repeated First context clarify account discrepancy Second followup to confirm adjustments So first call is to discuss an issue second is to confirm changes

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: C003 has Initiate Verify Docs Call Customer Adjust Account Verify Docs again Approve Verify Documents twice First is physical verification second is re verify after adjustment Call Customer once here but in C003s case the call is because the customer stepped out and needed to return

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the repeating activities across cases are Verify Documents and Call Customer

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now need to rename these to reflect their context based on position and context

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Verify Documents  In C001 First occurrence is initial verification second is after additional docs  In C002 Only one occurrence but in C003 first is physical second after adjustment

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Wait in C002 Verify Documents appears once In C001 and C003 twice So in C001 and C003 the two Verifies have different contexts So perhaps in those cases the first is Initial Document Verification and the second Re verification of Documents

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Similarly Call Customer in C002 is used twice with different purposes First to clarify discrepancy second to confirm adjustments So maybe Initial Clarification Call and Confirmation Call

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: In C003 the Call Customer is because the customer stepped out so maybe Recall Customer for Process Continuation

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Wait but the task says to rename activities that appear multiple times within the SAME case So for each case where an activity repeats we need to differentiate those instances

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking at C001s two Verify Documents first is initial check second is re check after docs submitted So rename first to Initial Document Verification and second to Document Re verification

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In C003s two Verify Documents first is physical verification second is after account adjustment So first could be Physical Document Verification and second Post Adjustment Document Re check

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: For Call Customer in C002 first is to clarify account issue second to confirm adjustments So first Account Clarification Call second Adjustment Confirmation Call

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: In C003s Call Customer its because the customer left so maybe Customer Recall Call

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now lets check if other activities repeat Adjust Account appears in C002 and C003 but not in the same case so no Submit Additional is unique Approve Request is same in all no need to change

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main activities to rename are Verify Documents and Call Customer where they repeat in a case

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets go through each case and adjust the names accordingly Now lets construct the revised log Now putting it all together
